taskbody.context: This chapter describes how to have the TAFJ features running in Design Studio.

step.cmd: Go to your Design Studio installation and create dropins folder. Open the directory.
Create a new file called TAFJ.link and edit it.
Set the variable path pointing to your TAFJ_HOME directory.
step.info: The path can be relative or absolute. Always use "/" and not "\" in your path.
step.stepresult: The file contains only one line. For instance: path=../../../DEV/TAFJ.

step.cmd: Save and close the file TAFJ.link.

taskbody.result: Design Studio can find the TAFJ Eclipse plugins Thanks to this link file. The TAFJ perspective and menu entries are now available in your IDE.
taskbody.postreq: Please refer to the full TAFJ Eclipse plug-in tooling documentation for more details, which is available in the [TAFJ_HOME]\doc directory.
